banners.title: Singapore Unlocked: A City of Bold Contrasts and Everyday Wonders
banners.description: Singapore might be small, but it offers big experiences. From futuristic architecture and lush gardens to world-famous street food and historic neighborhoods, this city-state blends tradition with innovation. Planning a trip here? This guide walks you through everything from top sights to budget tips so you can explore Singapore with ease.

banners.title: Smart Travel Deals and Combo Passes to See More for Less
banners.description:
Singapore doesn’t have to be expensive if you plan smart. There are plenty of deals that bundle top sights and help you save. 

 Combo passes often include Gardens by the Bay, the Singapore Flyer, and the Night Safari at a discounted rate. Hop-on hop-off buses give you a flexible way to explore. For public transport, an MRT tourist pass is a budget-friendly option.  

 Prices for guided day tours usually start around SGD 40 to 70, depending on what’s included. Booking online ahead of time? That’s where you’ll often find the best value.

banners.title: Navigate the City Like a Local with These Transport Tips
banners.description:
Getting around is easy. Singapore’s public transport is one of the best in the world, clean, safe, and fast. 

 Grab an EZ-Link card or a Tourist Pass to make bus and MRT rides simple. Most attractions are close to an MRT station, so you won’t need to rely on taxis often. But if you do, apps like Grab are widely used and reliable. 

 Pro tip: download the MyTransport.SG app to help plan your routes on the go.

banners.title: Plan Your Singapore Trip Today and Experience the Unexpected
banners.description:
Singapore is a city where the future meets tradition, where temples and skyscrapers share the skyline, and where street food can rival fine dining. Clean, welcoming, and full of surprises—it’s everything a modern traveler could want. 

 Discover Singapore now and start planning a trip that’s vibrant, diverse, and packed with unforgettable moments.

carousel.title: Explore Singapore’s Best-Kept Secrets and World-Famous Icons
carousel.intro: Singapore is packed with things to see, whether you're chasing iconic landmarks or tucked-away spots locals love.

items.heading: Marina Bay Sands
items.text: Incredible views from the SkyPark, luxury shops, and the famous rooftop pool.

items.heading: Gardens by the Bay
items.text: Home to Supertrees, the Cloud Forest, and a dazzling light show.

items.heading: Sentosa Island
items.text: Beaches, amusement parks, and family-friendly activities.

items.heading: Chinatown
items.text: Traditional shops, temples, and unbeatable hawker food.

carousel.title: Free and Low-Cost Activities That Make a Big Impact
carousel.intro: Yes, you can enjoy Singapore on a budget. You just have to know where to look.

items.heading: Walk around Marina Bay
items.text: Walk around Marina Bay and stay for the nightly Spectra light show, it’s free and stunning.

items.heading: Wander through heritage districts
items.text: Wander through heritage districts like Chinatown, Little India, and Kampong Glam.

items.heading: Enjoy green spaces
items.text: Enjoy green spaces like the Southern Ridges, MacRitchie Reservoir, or Fort Canning Park.

items.heading: Visit museums
items.text: Visit museums like the National Gallery or Asian Civilisations Museum on free-admission days.

card-img.title: Savor the City: Must-Try Dishes from Hawker Stalls to Hidden Gems
card-img.intro: Eating in Singapore is half the adventure. From hawker stalls to Michelin-starred street food, the variety is endless and delicious.

items.heading: Hainanese Chicken Rice
items.text: Simple, clean flavors with tender chicken and fragrant rice.

items.heading: Laksa
items.text: Spicy, coconut-based noodle soup with prawns and fishcake.

items.heading: Char Kway Teow
items.text: Smoky stir-fried noodles with eggs, bean sprouts, and Chinese sausage.

items.heading: Chili Crab
items.text: A spicy, sweet, finger-licking seafood favorite.

items.heading: Satay
items.text: Grilled meat skewers served with rich peanut sauce.

img-with-icon-content.title: Unique Experiences You Can’t Leave Singapore Without
img-with-icon-content.description: There’s always something to do, no matter your mood or budget.

items.title: Boat ride
items.text: Take a boat ride along the Singapore River and see the skyline from the water.

items.title: Supertree light show
items.text: Watch the Supertree light show for free at Gardens by the Bay.

items.title: Cable car
items.text: Ride the cable car to Sentosa for an overhead view of the island and city.

items.title: Outdoor Movie
items.text: Catch an outdoor movie at Marina Barrage or have a sunset picnic with locals.

items.title: Sip a cocktail
items.text: Sip a cocktail at one of Singapore’s rooftop bars 1-Altitude and Ce La Vi are top picks.
Mix and match these activities for a trip that feels just right.

img-with-icon-content.title: Travel Smarter with These Local Tips and Safety Notes

items.title: Visit between February and April
items.text: Visit between February and April for pleasant weather and fewer crowds.

items.title: Laws are strict
items.text: Laws are strict, so avoid littering, jaywalking, or bringing chewing gum.

items.title: English is widely spoken
items.text: English is widely spoken, making it easy to ask for help or directions.

items.title: Tipping isn’t expected
items.text: Tipping isn’t expected, but rounding up is appreciated in taxis or at casual restaurants.

items.title: Incredibly safe
items.text: Singapore is incredibly safe, but still be mindful of personal belongings.
A little preparation goes a long way and lets you enjoy more of what really matters.
